name: facad
description: Modern, colorful directory listing tool for the command-line

repo.name: facad
repo.description: A modern, colorful ls alternative for bringing clarity to the filesystem ☀️

readme.summary: Clear and well-structured README with excellent installation instructions but lacking configuration details and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No documentation of configuration options, command-line flags beyond basic usage, or troubleshooting common issues

injection_risks.description: Use of fnmatch() with user-controlled input may lead to potential issues if not properly sanitized
Use of system calls like chdir() and getcwd() with user-controlled input may pose a risk if not validated

critical_findings: Potential for directory traversal attacks if input is not properly sanitized
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and insufficient input validation, but no critical secrets or severe vulnerabilities were found.

common_complaints: Poor error messages (misleading vs. exact file-not-found errors)
Limited command-line argument handling (single argument only, no wildcards)
Missing or inadequate documentation (no manpage, unhelpful help output)
Feature gaps compared to standard ls (no colon-separated PATH support)
praise_themes: Clean, modern implementation of ls replacement
Appreciation for the project concept and execution
sentiment.summary: Moderately healthy community with active engagement, but users frustrated by build issues, poor error handling, and feature gaps; maintainer shows moderate responsiveness with some issues resolved but several open requests pending.

communication.summary: Responses are generally clear and helpful, showing a good level of patience with contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being 5 months ago
8 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
No releases tracked, suggesting no versioning or deployment activity
maintenance.summary: The facad package appears abandoned with no development activity, issue resolution, or contributor engagement in the past 6 months.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a clear introduction and installation instructions, but lacks detailed examples and troubleshooting information.
concerns: No merged PRs in the past six months, indicating a lack of community contribution or approval.
Zero closed issues and two open PRs suggest that there might be unaddressed problems or feature requests.
Docs: Insufficient documentation of configuration options and troubleshooting guides
Security: Potential for directory traversal attacks if input is not properly sanitized
Security: Information disclosure through error messages
High bus factor risk (97% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent commits and releases within the last month indicate some level of activity.
One contributor is still active, which suggests ongoing engagement with the project.
